body: Thanks for your contribution.
Thank you for your contribution.
Thank you for your contribution.
Spring version upgrade cannot be done without a refactoring in the code.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Yes, it looks like AxisConfiguration is parsed as the source AxisDescription while it should be the ProxyService itself. So currently the observers that are observing the axis configuration changes get notified for a module engage in proxy service, which is wrong. I will review and merge the PR.
Thanks for your contribution.

There is no conclusive fact to claim that using Random.nextDouble() gives a significant performance gain over Math.Random(). 
I found the following resources, but those are not good enough to make a drastic change in the codebase. 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/738629/math-random-versus-random-nextintint
https://community.oracle.com/message/6596485?#6594485

Do you have any other resources or proof to prove that we could gain a performance improvement by doing this change?
Can you please explain the fix, I can't understand the difference in the logic made by this PR
@isudana yes this is a mistake. I will close the pull request.
Closing this PR and I will send a new one.
Closing this PR. I have sent the same PR from a different branch.
Btw, do let me know if there is way to write a solid test-case for this.
@isudana  we should look into this feature
Thanks Shafreen, I will take time and review the PR.
Had to close this PR due to unwanted commits.

Please find the new PR.
https://github.com/apache/synapse/pull/41

> Spring version upgrade cannot be done without a refactoring in the code.

Hello, 

Is it possible to upgrade to 4.x ?
We need this to support Elastic APM. We can pay for this request

https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/apm/agent/java/current/supported-technologies-details.html#supported-web-frameworks

I think the main issue is the version of spring.
We need at least spring 4.x

@jvkassi 
Can you please let us know for what type of use cases are you using Synapse?
Depending on that we'll see the possibility of upgrading the Spring version. 

btw, Synapse is a community-driven, open-source project. We do not accept payments :)

Hello,

Great to hear from you !
We are using WSO2 Api Manager and it using wso2-synapse that use apache-synapse.
Apache-synapse use a old version of spring-boot that is not compatible with elastic apm. 
Elastic APM is an application monitoring tool. It permit us to get more insight on our application. It works great with Apache tomcat server 
 
We need apache-synapse to bump the version to at least spring 4.x to support it
Here is the link of support web frameworks
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/apm/agent/java/current/supported-technologies-details.html#supported-web-frameworks

This PR is for wso2-synapse.
https://github.com/wso2/wso2-synapse/pull/1358
Can you base the pull request directly on the master branch and get rid of the extra commits?
Created a fresh PR without the polluting commits: https://github.com/apache/synapse/pull/54

@sajithaliyanage 

it's great job bro,
I think they should merge it.
anyway I suggest you to provide more dynamic resolver for actual value to support the following form :
$body/tagName/tgaName....etc 
it will help more for testing really actual values.
@sajithaliyanage Will you be able to resolve the conflicts and update the PR?
